title: Epitaph for Domitius Himeraeus, his sister Domitia and his wife Alfia Zotica
support: A thick rectangular plaque of grey limestone, slightly damaged on the left edge, but intact on the other three sides, with rectangular recesses for clamps in each preserved edge (two each on the upper and lower edges (middle and right), with possibly a third lost from the left end on each of the upper and lower edges; one on the right edge).

layout.p: Three lines of roughly equal and centred latin letters filling the face of the stone, words separated by lightly carved interpuncts.

handNote.lettering: Simply cut reasonably regular letters, with one instance of ligature and an extended T in line 2.

date._: Bivona suggests that the onomastics (presence of tribal, use of Aulus and lack of cognomen in the sister's name) imply a date in the first half of the C1 CE

provenanceFound._: First recorded by Torremuzza in the inscriptions of Palermo (1769). The attribution to Termini is based upon the cognomen / ethnic Himeraeus rather than any other evidence.

provenanceObserved._: Photographed 2021-09-27 in Palermo museum, but no formal autopsy

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2021-09-27

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
museum.description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
